item.title: Unknown Person using litter box to dispose of food waste., 28th September
item.description:
I have been reporting this problem for over 12 months now and it still hasn‚Äôt been resolved or removed. Someone uses the on street litter box to dispose of their food waste and the foxes pull it out including the dog waste bags. I have been cleaning it up for a long time now because no one else will. It‚Äôs annoying and antisocial behaviour. Vermin are feeding from the same waste and I don‚Äôt want to live in a place where this becomes normality, and ignored.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grosvenor Park, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Misused rubbish bin- danger to drivers (9). Summary includes number of times same recurring offence reported since 16/09/2025. This rubbish bin is daily used for domestic rubbish. Wind often takes debris and bags to the middle of the road and it is an accident waiting to happen. I have already witnessed a motorist and a cyclist falling trying to avoid the debris., 28th September
item.description:
The solution is to remove the bin or to apply existing legislation and fine the recurring offenders- ‚Äú Westminster City Council issued zero Fixed Penalty Notices (FPNs) for fly-tipping in the 2023-24 period, according to data from GOV.UK. While the council has the power to issue FPNs, they did not use this specific enforcement measure in the most recent reporting year‚Äù üßê

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, West Eaton Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of illegally placed flags along A220 between Carlton road and brook street, 27th September
item.description:
Seen on 27 Sep. Today we saw over 20 flags lining the A220. All illegally placed about half way up the lamp posts on both sides of the A220 between Carlton road and brook street. These are very distracting for motorist. These illegally placed flags are very upsetting and are a blatant show of disregard for the local communities. Other councils have openly condemned these flags and actively started taking them down. Why oh why is the Bexley council not standing up for their communities and removing them as they rightly should. As a white British I find these flags very upsetting. Every time we go out of the house there are more and more. Learn from history and don‚Äôt let it be repeated
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Street, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
